verses.roman:
plakṣādiṣu pañcasu puruṣāṇām āyur indriyam
ojaḥ saho balaṁ buddhir vikrama iti ca
sarveṣām autpattikī siddhir aviśeṣeṇa vartate

synonyms: plakṣa-ādiṣu—in the islands headed by Plakṣa; pañcasu—five; puruṣāṇām—of the inhabitants; āyuḥ—long duration of life; indriyam—soundness of the senses; ojaḥ—bodily strength; sahaḥ—mental strength; balam—physical strength; buddhiḥ—intelligence; vikramaḥ—bravery; iti—thus; ca—also; sarveṣām—of all of them; autpattikī—inborn; siddhiḥ—perfection; aviśeṣeṇa—without distinction; vartate—exists.
translation: O King, longevity, sensory prowess, physical and mental strength, intelligence and bravery are naturally and equally manifested in all the inhabitants of the five islands headed by Plakṣadvīpa.
